trans-unit.source: Intro to certificates
trans-unit.target: Intro to certificates

trans-unit.source: This article discusses the use of certificates in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses the use of certificates in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: Intro to certificates
trans-unit.target: Intro to certificates

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This article discusses the use of certificates in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses the use of certificates in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.
trans-unit.target: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.

trans-unit.source: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.
trans-unit.target: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.

trans-unit.source: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.
trans-unit.target: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.

trans-unit.source: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.
trans-unit.target: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.

trans-unit.source: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: Shared certificate stores
trans-unit.target: Shared certificate stores

trans-unit.source: UWP apps use the new isolationist application model introduced in Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: UWP apps use the new isolationist application model introduced in Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: In this model, apps run in low-level operating system construct, called an app container, that prohibits the app from accessing resources or files outside of itself unless explicitly permitted to do so.
trans-unit.target: In this model, apps run in low-level operating system construct, called an app container, that prohibits the app from accessing resources or files outside of itself unless explicitly permitted to do so.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe the implications this has on public key infrastructure (PKI).
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe the implications this has on public key infrastructure (PKI).

trans-unit.source: Certificate storage per app container
trans-unit.target: Certificate storage per app container

trans-unit.source: Certificates that are intended for use in a specific app container are stored in per user, per app container locations.
trans-unit.target: Certificates that are intended for use in a specific app container are stored in per user, per app container locations.

trans-unit.source: An app running in an app container has write access to only its own certificate storage.
trans-unit.target: An app running in an app container has write access to only its own certificate storage.

trans-unit.source: If the application adds certificates to any of its stores, these certificates cannot be read by other apps.
trans-unit.target: If the application adds certificates to any of its stores, these certificates cannot be read by other apps.

trans-unit.source: If an app is uninstalled, any certificates specific to it are also removed.
trans-unit.target: If an app is uninstalled, any certificates specific to it are also removed.

trans-unit.source: An app also has read access to local machine certificate stores other than the MY and REQUEST store.
trans-unit.target: An app also has read access to local machine certificate stores other than the MY and REQUEST store.

trans-unit.source: Cache
trans-unit.target: Cache

trans-unit.source: Each app container has an isolated cache in which it can store issuer certificates needed for validation, certificate revocation lists (CRL), and online certificate status protocol (OCSP) responses.
trans-unit.target: Each app container has an isolated cache in which it can store issuer certificates needed for validation, certificate revocation lists (CRL), and online certificate status protocol (OCSP) responses.

trans-unit.source: Shared certificates and keys
trans-unit.target: Shared certificates and keys

trans-unit.source: When a smart card is inserted into a reader, the certificates and keys contained on the card are propagated to the user MY store where they can be shared by any full-trust application the user is running.
trans-unit.target: When a smart card is inserted into a reader, the certificates and keys contained on the card are propagated to the user MY store where they can be shared by any full-trust application the user is running.

trans-unit.source: By default, however, app containers do not have access to the per user MY store.
trans-unit.target: By default, however, app containers do not have access to the per user MY store.

trans-unit.source: To address this issue and enable groups of principals to access groups of resources, the app container isolation model supports the capabilities concept.
trans-unit.target: To address this issue and enable groups of principals to access groups of resources, the app container isolation model supports the capabilities concept.

trans-unit.source: A capability allows an app container process to access a specific resource.
trans-unit.target: A capability allows an app container process to access a specific resource.

trans-unit.source: The sharedUserCertificates capability grants an app container read access to the certificates and keys contained in the user MY store and the Smart Card Trusted Roots store.
trans-unit.target: The sharedUserCertificates capability grants an app container read access to the certificates and keys contained in the user MY store and the Smart Card Trusted Roots store.

trans-unit.source: The capability does not grant read access to the user REQUEST store.
trans-unit.target: The capability does not grant read access to the user REQUEST store.

trans-unit.source: You specify the sharedUserCertificates capability in the manifest as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: You specify the sharedUserCertificates capability in the manifest as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: Certificate fields
trans-unit.target: Certificate fields

trans-unit.source: The X.509 public key certificate standard has been revised over time.
trans-unit.target: The X.509 public key certificate standard has been revised over time.

trans-unit.source: Each successive version of the data structure has retained the fields that existed in the previous versions and added more, as shown in the following illustration.
trans-unit.target: Each successive version of the data structure has retained the fields that existed in the previous versions and added more, as shown in the following illustration.

trans-unit.source: x.509 certificate versions 1, 2, and 3
trans-unit.target: x.509 certificate versions 1, 2, and 3

trans-unit.source: Some of these fields and extensions can be specified directly when you use the [**CertificateRequestProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br212079) class to create a certificate request.
trans-unit.target: Some of these fields and extensions can be specified directly when you use the [**CertificateRequestProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br212079) class to create a certificate request.

trans-unit.source: Most cannot.
trans-unit.target: Most cannot.

trans-unit.source: These fields can be filled by the issuing authority or they can be left blank.
trans-unit.target: These fields can be filled by the issuing authority or they can be left blank.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the fields, see the following sections:
trans-unit.target: For more information about the fields, see the following sections:

trans-unit.source: Version 1 fields
trans-unit.target: Version 1 fields

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Version
trans-unit.target: Version

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version number of the encoded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version number of the encoded certificate.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the possible values of this field are 0, 1, or 2.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the possible values of this field are 0, 1, or 2.

trans-unit.source: Serial Number
trans-unit.target: Serial Number

trans-unit.source: Contains a positive, unique integer assigned by the certification authority (CA) to the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Contains a positive, unique integer assigned by the certification authority (CA) to the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Signature Algorithm
trans-unit.target: Signature Algorithm

trans-unit.source: Contains an object identifier (OID) that specifies the algorithm used by the CA to sign the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Contains an object identifier (OID) that specifies the algorithm used by the CA to sign the certificate.

trans-unit.source: For example, 1.2.840.113549.1.1.5 specifies a SHA-1 hashing algorithm combined with the RSA encryption algorithm from RSA Laboratories.
trans-unit.target: For example, 1.2.840.113549.1.1.5 specifies a SHA-1 hashing algorithm combined with the RSA encryption algorithm from RSA Laboratories.

trans-unit.source: Issuer
trans-unit.target: Issuer

trans-unit.source: Contains the X.500 distinguished name (DN) of the CA that created and signed the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Contains the X.500 distinguished name (DN) of the CA that created and signed the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Validity
trans-unit.target: Validity

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time interval during which the certificate is valid.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the time interval during which the certificate is valid.

trans-unit.source: Dates through the end of 2049 use the Coordinated Universal Time (Greenwich Mean Time) format (yymmddhhmmssz).
trans-unit.target: Dates through the end of 2049 use the Coordinated Universal Time (Greenwich Mean Time) format (yymmddhhmmssz).

trans-unit.source: Dates beginning with January 1st, 2050 use the generalized time format (yyyymmddhhmmssz).
trans-unit.target: Dates beginning with January 1st, 2050 use the generalized time format (yyyymmddhhmmssz).

trans-unit.source: Subject
trans-unit.target: Subject

trans-unit.source: Contains an X.500 distinguished name of the entity associated with the public key contained in the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Contains an X.500 distinguished name of the entity associated with the public key contained in the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Public Key
trans-unit.target: Public Key

trans-unit.source: Contains the public key and associated algorithm information.
trans-unit.target: Contains the public key and associated algorithm information.

trans-unit.source: Version 2 fields
trans-unit.target: Version 2 fields

trans-unit.source: An X.509 version 2 certificate contains the basic fields defined in version 1 and adds the following fields.
trans-unit.target: An X.509 version 2 certificate contains the basic fields defined in version 1 and adds the following fields.

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Issuer Unique Identifier
trans-unit.target: Issuer Unique Identifier

trans-unit.source: Contains a unique value that can be used to make the X.500 name of the CA unambiguous when reused by different entities over time.
trans-unit.target: Contains a unique value that can be used to make the X.500 name of the CA unambiguous when reused by different entities over time.

trans-unit.source: Subject Unique Identifier
trans-unit.target: Subject Unique Identifier

trans-unit.source: Contains a unique value that can be used to make the X.500 name of the certificate subject unambiguous when reused by different entities over time.
trans-unit.target: Contains a unique value that can be used to make the X.500 name of the certificate subject unambiguous when reused by different entities over time.

trans-unit.source: Version 3 extensions
trans-unit.target: Version 3 extensions

trans-unit.source: An X.509 version 3 certificate contains the fields defined in version 1 and version 2 and adds certificate extensions.
trans-unit.target: An X.509 version 3 certificate contains the fields defined in version 1 and version 2 and adds certificate extensions.

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Authority Key Identifier
trans-unit.target: Authority Key Identifier

trans-unit.source: Identifies the certification authority (CA) public key that corresponds to the CA private key used to sign the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the certification authority (CA) public key that corresponds to the CA private key used to sign the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Basic Constraints
trans-unit.target: Basic Constraints

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the entity can be used as a CA and, if so, the number of subordinate CAs that can exist beneath it in the certificate chain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the entity can be used as a CA and, if so, the number of subordinate CAs that can exist beneath it in the certificate chain.

trans-unit.source: Certificate Policies
trans-unit.target: Certificate Policies

trans-unit.source: Specifies the policies under which the certificate has been issued and the purposes for which it can be used.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the policies under which the certificate has been issued and the purposes for which it can be used.

trans-unit.source: CRL Distribution Points
trans-unit.target: CRL Distribution Points

trans-unit.source: Contains the URI of the base certificate revocation list (CRL).
trans-unit.target: Contains the URI of the base certificate revocation list (CRL).

trans-unit.source: Enhanced Key Usage
trans-unit.target: Enhanced Key Usage

trans-unit.source: Specifies the manner in which the public key contained in the certificate can be used.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the manner in which the public key contained in the certificate can be used.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Alternative Name
trans-unit.target: Issuer Alternative Name

trans-unit.source: Specifies one or more alternative name forms for the issuer of the certificate request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies one or more alternative name forms for the issuer of the certificate request.

trans-unit.source: Key Usage
trans-unit.target: Key Usage

trans-unit.source: Specifies restrictions on the operations that can be performed by the public key contained in the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specifies restrictions on the operations that can be performed by the public key contained in the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Name Constraints
trans-unit.target: Name Constraints

trans-unit.source: Specifies the namespace within which all subject names in a certificate hierarchy must be located.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the namespace within which all subject names in a certificate hierarchy must be located.

trans-unit.source: The extension is used only in a CA certificate.
trans-unit.target: The extension is used only in a CA certificate.

trans-unit.source: Policy Constraints
trans-unit.target: Policy Constraints

trans-unit.source: Constrains path validation by prohibiting policy mapping or by requiring that each certificate in the hierarchy contain an acceptable policy identifier.
trans-unit.target: Constrains path validation by prohibiting policy mapping or by requiring that each certificate in the hierarchy contain an acceptable policy identifier.

trans-unit.source: The extension is used only in a CA certificate.
trans-unit.target: The extension is used only in a CA certificate.

trans-unit.source: Policy Mappings
trans-unit.target: Policy Mappings

trans-unit.source: Specifies the policies in a subordinate CA that correspond to policies in the issuing CA.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the policies in a subordinate CA that correspond to policies in the issuing CA.

trans-unit.source: Private Key Usage Period
trans-unit.target: Private Key Usage Period

trans-unit.source: Specifies a different validity period for the private key than for the certificate with which the private key is associated.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a different validity period for the private key than for the certificate with which the private key is associated.

trans-unit.source: Subject Alternative Name
trans-unit.target: Subject Alternative Name

trans-unit.source: Specifies one or more alternative name forms for the subject of the certificate request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies one or more alternative name forms for the subject of the certificate request.

trans-unit.source: Example alternative forms include email addresses, DNS names, IP addresses, and URIs.
trans-unit.target: Example alternative forms include email addresses, DNS names, IP addresses, and URIs.

trans-unit.source: Subject Directory Attributes
trans-unit.target: Subject Directory Attributes

trans-unit.source: Conveys identification attributes such as the nationality of the certificate subject.
trans-unit.target: Conveys identification attributes such as the nationality of the certificate subject.

trans-unit.source: The extension value is a sequence of OID-value pairs.
trans-unit.target: The extension value is a sequence of OID-value pairs.

trans-unit.source: Subject Key Identifier
trans-unit.target: Subject Key Identifier

trans-unit.source: Differentiates between multiple public keys held by the certificate subject.
trans-unit.target: Differentiates between multiple public keys held by the certificate subject.

trans-unit.source: The extension value is typically a SHA-1 hash of the key.
trans-unit.target: The extension value is typically a SHA-1 hash of the key.
